column5: [QUOTE=prov1800;6653052]That's a lot of ice for this time year,wonder what the odds are in Vegas for may 21 ice out in Ontario?
[QUOTE=prov1800;6653052]So imagine a 100 to 200 miles north of you john there's much more than 30 inches?

[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6653080]It tends to be about the same up north as down here.But will more than likely have warmer temps bit south.Need constant temps right now to open up some areas and wind to be able to move ice sheets around.next 2 weeks pretty criticle

I pulled the second shack off the ice today (May 3rd). There is still lots of slush, but not too thick and the in-between layer of water seems to have gone down to just a couple of inches. The ice is lifting and several air holes have appeared, there is still probably 2 feet of ice. This is latest I have ever had an ice shack out, it is an unusual year.
[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6653076]If you get to Lake Superior in Duluth and you still see ice you are screwed. Been there done that in 1996 on Lac Seul. PjShorthorn

Here is a pic of the Shanty Narrows Wayne Clark took the other day flying over it.Opening up a bit with the current flowing through that area.Got warm weather coming now so hope it starts melting a lot faster.We have a day planned Teusday to go ice fishing on Cliff Lake.That's nuts.
20 days left I believe to lose it,gotta also have time for outfitters to get there camps or outposts open.

Drive ins no problem and they have planes to get to all outposts and do what's needed.Just need a sweeping and dusting.Everything else will be fine. Just need to get water going.Just need to get rid of ice.
Fix all the leaky boats,get the motors to run,lots of things could have happend over the winter,don't know until they survey the outpost,you know,,,damage control.

Could have a couple of issues i guess. Never been in a leaky boat at any of Clarks outposts.They take care of things in the fall as they close up.So easier start up.His nephew Chris will be putting boats in the water and takes care of any issues.Amazing guy.
Pushing a 95 degrees daily in Thailand so I wish I could send the heat your way to warm things up.
[QUOTE=RichA$1970;6652948]Pushing a 95 degrees daily in Thailand so I wish I could send the heat your way to warm things up.[/QUOTEGot some coming.Looking much better but maybe bit late but will see.
[QUOTE=prov1800;6652978]19 days to lose it all for the opener guests.
That's alittle to warm I would say,nice view you have there rich.

[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6653032]When you put it that way it just doesn't sound like much time.Tomorow the nice weatger comes and looks like it will stick.-5 tonight so we will have some harder ice surface on our ice fishing trip.Hope it doesn't get to soft as day goes on.Probably last trip.Wayne drilled a hole by his plane on Edward Lake and Had around 30" he told me.Come on heat.
